drifts.text: Wait. Didn't you already talk to them? Yesterday? Or was that a dream? The conversation feels familiar, but the details are slipping away.
You remember finding a crucial piece of evidence. You can picture it clearly. But when you check your notes, there's no record of it. Did you imagine it?
You could swear they died. You remember the body. The blood. But here they are, alive and talking. Were you wrong? Or is this wrong?
How long have you been here? Days? Weeks? The timeline doesn't add up. Events are out of order in your memory.
You remember them confessing. The words are clear in your mind. But they're denying it now. Did they really say it, or did you want them to?
There was a room here. You're certain of it. But now there's just a wall. Has it always been a wall?
They're treating you like a stranger. But you remember shared moments, conversations, trust. Were those memories real?
Why are you here again? The reason feels distant, foggy. You know it was important, but the details are slipping through your fingers like water.
